Exciting developments unfolded as our PR and GR team in Indonesia joined a focus group discussion with the International Council on Clean Transportation (ICCT) alongside other ride-hailing companies in the country. The center of the conversation was the future of electric vehicles (EVs) in Indonesia. They delved into the essential role that the private sector plays in shaping the EV ecosystem and contributing to the country's sustainable transportation vision. One of the highlights of the FGD was the presentation of the ICCT's research, "The Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) Analysis for EV in Ride-hailing Fleet in Indonesia." This insightful analysis sheds light on the economic viability of EVs within ride-hailing fleets, a crucial aspect of promoting environmentally friendly transportation options. We are proud to endorse and support the government's initiative to transform the transportation sector. By actively engaging in discussions, we are committed to providing reliable and sustainable mobility alternatives for the communities were we are present. #Peopledriven #inDrive #SustainableMobility #EVFuture

The Hyundai EV Ioniq 5 will bring me to the hotel. The design looks so chic. #HyundaiIoniq5 #ElectricVehicles #EcoFriendly #SustainableTravel Electric vehicles (EVs) do offer a significant reduction in air pollution compared to internal combustion engine vehicles. #CleanEnergy #AirQuality However, they introduce challenges in battery disposal and resource scarcity. #BatteryRecycling #ResourceManagement Used EV batteries need to be recycled or repurposed to prevent environmental harm, #SustainableSolutions and the mining of materials like lithium, cobalt, and nickel for batteries has raised concerns about sustainability and ethical sourcing. #EthicalMining These issues highlight the need for advancements in battery technology, improved recycling infrastructure, and the development of more sustainable mining practices to address the environmental footprint of EVs. #Innovation #GreenTech The Indonesian government is championing the shift to electric vehicles with a robust subsidy program to ramp up EV sales and fast-track their uptake. This strategic move is designed to bolster the electric motorcycles and cars market, facilitating a switch from traditional combustion engines. It's part of an overarching plan to tap into Indonesia's abundant nickel resources for EV battery production. Despite facing hurdles such as EV affordability and the need for more charging stations, this push signals a strong commitment to a greener, more #SustainableTransport future. #ElectricVehicles #GreenEnergy #EcoFriendly #IndonesiaEVInitiative
